result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael W Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $100 fine plus costs.  (fine and costs have been paid in full)

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

to amend criminal complaint
Order to Amend Criminal Complaint
Motion to Amend Criminal Complaint
from Defendant with Certificate of Completion
to Extend the Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement
Defendant in custody.

Defendant Michael W Clark in court, in custody.  Nicholas Grode appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court reviews events in file, reviews State's motion to revoke DAGPA.  Court questions defendant on whether he wishes to proceed without counsel.  Defendant indicates he doesn't qualify for PD representation, can't afford an attorney on his own.   Defendant wishes to waive his right to Counsel.  Court questions Defendant, finds defendant competent to proceed, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver.    State has no objection to extending the deferred agreement for 9 months to give defendant time to complete ATV program. Other option would be that defendant revoke DAGPA on his own and proceed to sentencing as charged.  Defendant would like time to complete ATV program. Court finds motion to revoke was timely made, grants extension of DAGPA to 3/18/19.  State will prepare amended order. Court quashes warrant. State okay with 6 month ATV program defendant found to attend in Iowa. Court orders defendant to provide ADA Grode with information as to who will be doing assessment prior to order being done to be sure State agrees with program.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for March 18, 2019 at 08:50 am.
Further proceedings on July 16, 2018 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Michael W Clark not in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Discussion regarding attempts at service. State requests bench warrant, reviews change of Court date, attempts to have Defendant served, advises of conversation with HELP of Door County during which she was advised that Defendant did not have any counseling. Court orders bench warrant.
Motion hearing on December 21, 2016 at 02:15 pm.

Defendant Michael W Clark not in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, including mailing of Hearing Notice. State advises that Motion has not been sent to Defendant. State will have motion served on Defendant, advises that she contacted HELP of Door County who had no record of Defendant being assessed or any counseling.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 02:15 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 21, 2016 at 02:15 pm.
Sentencing hearing on December 8, 2016 at 11:30 am.
to vacate DAGPA

Defendant Michael W Clark not in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State checked this morning to see if Defendant complied, has nothing to indicate he has, files motion to vacate Deferred. State advises that nothing has been received to indicate Defendant has had an assessment. Discussion regarding payment of fine. State requests that Court put off ruling on motion until next hearing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 8, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Deferred Acceptance of Guilty Plea Agreement

Defendant Michael W Clark in court. Joan M. Korb appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews previous activity, questions Defendant on progress with DA. State advises that Defendant made appointment, didn't show up. Defendant does not know what offer is. State advises that offer was mailed 11/4. Defendant wants to accept offer. Court questions Defendant on continued waiver of right to counsel, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, elements. Defendant enters guilty plea. Court questions Defendant on rights, finds plea made freely and voluntarily, finds basis to accept plea, withholds acceptance of plea, reviews conditions contained within DAGPA, approves DAGPA. Court advises Defendant to contact DA's office prior to next Court date to ensure that all conditions have been completed.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for November 14, 2016 at 10:00 am.

No violent contact with CB.

Defendant Michael W Clark in court. Raymond Pelrine appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Copy of Complaint given to Defendant in Court. Court reviews charge, max. penalties, right to counsel. Defendant wants to try to resolve matter with DA, waives right to Counsel. Court questions Defendant, finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver. Defendant to make appointment with DA. Bond set.  Status conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted on 9/27/15.
